name: All Inn The Family B&B

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I arrived to the beautiful house with my wife and my sister last september, and stayed for 3 nights. We stayed in one of the upper floor rooms, and my sister in one of the bottom ones. Each room has its charm, they are not big, but big enough, besides, if you what to stay in a typical Jordaan house, this experience is it.
reviews.title: Great Stay, 10 points for Hospitality

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: The house is charming, and even though people have complained about the steep staircase, we found it different and part of the experience of staying in a house in the Jordaan, we had no trouble with it at all. Breakfast is delicious and both Marion and Anne make you feel at home. Both of them are really nice and helpful. We even had the chance to meet their daughter and beautiful grandaughter. Anne even help my try to change my flight to Madrid, for which we had to call ten times from the house phone, and they didn't charge me for it!
reviews.title: 10 points for Marion & Anne

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The only thing that we think could be better is the upper floor bathroom (that you share with the other upper floor room).
reviews.title: back to my hometown

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We found the area around the house the best place to stay in Amsterdam. It's a beautiful and there are lots of great restaurants nearby. Marion and Anne recomended an italian place called La Perla, which was great. There are beautiful little stores, it's near Anne Franks House, and it is a great base to explore all of Amsterdam.
reviews.title: Home from home!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled solo
reviews.text: We really enjoyed our stay, and will definetively stay again. We recomend it to anyone who wants to change a hotel room for an experience in Real Amsterdam.
reviews.title: Return To All Inn The Family

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: . . . as a B&B can possibly get - all the warmth and coziness you can hope for on a January visit, and Marion & Anne not only made us feel at home away from home, but our baby daughter as well.
reviews.title: As good. . .

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The breakfast lives up to its reputation on these pages, and the location can hardly be better for whatever you might like to see in historic Amsterdam. To top it off, the bells of the Westertoren quietly rung us to sleep and woke us from our dreams when breakfast was waiting. When we're back in town, this is where you'll find us (hopefully, there'll be a room...).
reviews.title: Best place we stayed in Europe!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: Where to start... Marion and Anne are down to earth awesome people!
reviews.title: Great for my Family

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: My friend and I were travelling around Europe and this was the best place we stayed for the entire trip! We stayed over the the New years eve period and had an absolute ball. We felt so welcomed and relaxed in their home. The breakfast was so fresh and yummy. Beds and linen extremely comfortable and clean. Location was gorgeous, walking distance to the city centre the house is central to everything. This was a home away from home for us! Was truly a memorable stay. Would love to come back and stay with some more friends.
reviews.title: True Magic!Now we know where to stay in Amsterdam!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Thanks for a wonderful time!
reviews.title: fantastic stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I had a very pleasant stay with Marion and Anne. We had the attic room which was cozy. I enjoyed being able to open the window and look out to the street. You could not ask for a better location. Very quite neighborhood surrounded by canals with lots of restaurants near by. About a 15 minute walk from the train station. We ended up being the only couple staying as the family that rented the other three rooms did not show. The breakfast was great also. Next time we are in Amsterdam I hope to be able to stay here again.
reviews.title: wonderful hosts

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a so nice stay in the B&B. Marion & Anne are great people. Comfortable bed, very good breakfast. Yes the fruit salad is delicious, and the breakfast talks are food for thoughts ;-) . The place is well situated in Amsterdam. We felt really good in this place, and wish to come back there, during our next trip to Amsterdam.
reviews.title: Warm people, Comfortable room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you're rubbing your chin wondering which place to choose for your stay in Amsterdam,rub no longer. We've been to Amsterdam many times and stayed in a variety of accommodation but this was by far the best. From the moment you arrive you're greeted like friends and shown to a very comfortable room. Anne and Marion were the best hosts and went out of their way to make us feel at home and we especially looked forward to the excellent breakfast and great banter. The Hotel itself is situated in a great part of the Jordaan and is surrounded by bars, eetcafes and restraunts.
reviews.title: A Little Slice of Home

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: We really had a great time and would definitely stay there again. Many thanks to you both.
reviews.title: Warm and family friendly

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Ciaran & Adrienne. Dublin
reviews.title: Lovely B&B in a great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It was my birthday and we were looking for some where special to celebrate. Having been to Amsterdam before we decided it would be the perfect choice.
reviews.title: I Have Found My Second Home

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After a little research we stumbled across All In The Family B&B and we were so glad we did.
reviews.title: Amsterdam in all its beauty

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: From the moment we walked through the door we felt as though we were home and about to enjoy a stay with some very old friends. Marion and Anne are perfect hosts and it is impossible not to warm to them and feel at your ease. We did not feel we were checking in to some faceless hotel, we felt we were becoming part of their family.
reviews.title: Great hosts, great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room at the top of the house was warm and very cosy, perfect for this time of year, and had everything you could need for a comfortable stay. If you have been to Amsterdam before you will know that space can be at a premium in many of it's buildings, build it tall and thin was the motto, yet our room never felt cramped, thanks to some clever use of space and some ingenious touches. The stairs can be a challenge, again very common in Amsterdam, but there was so many things to see as you ascend that before you knew it the climb was done. You could always pause and dwell a while to admire one of Marion and Anne's many paintings.
reviews.title: feels like staying with good friends

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled solo
reviews.text: Breakfast was superb. Fresh fruit, cereal, bread, cheese and cold meats, all washed down with freshly squeezed orange juice and fresh coffee. But the best part of breakfast was the fact it was taken round one big table like breakfast should be. I am really going to miss the convivial conversation.
reviews.title: A wonderful base for exploring Amsterdam

description: Welcome to B&B "All Inn The Family", your family home away from home in the "gezelligste" (coziest) street of the Jordaan neighborhood, part of the historic centre of Amsterdam. 2 completely renovated loft guestrooms with an intermediate bathroom with shower and toilet, Located on the third floor and accessible by stairs. The rooms are not big, but comfortably furnished with a sink, excellent double bed, fan, kettle and fridge. From August first 2012 our new garden house will be ready for 2 -4 guests, also very comfortably furnished with a double bed and sleeping couch for 2, own bathroom and kitchenette. We heartily offer you our hospitality and privacy. We speak English, French, German and Italian and are very much looking forward to make you feel at home in our beautiful city.
